meanings.definition: Present participle of 'rin' - to wash or cleanse something by immersing it in water
meanings.sent1: She was rinning the dishes in the sink.
meanings.sent2: After playing in the mud, he needed to start rinning his clothes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy enjoyed rinning through the sprinkler.
meanings.sent4: The river was rinning swiftly after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rinning water was soothing to her ears.

meanings.definition: Present participle of 'rin' - to remove dirt or impurities from something by washing
meanings.sent1: Mom was rinning the stains out of the carpet.
meanings.sent2: The laundry detergent was effective in rinning out tough stains.
meanings.sent3: The car wash did a great job rinning away all the dirt.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain was rinning the pollution from the air.
meanings.sent5: The soap was rinning down the drain as she washed her hands.

meanings.definition: Present participle of 'rin' - to flow or move in a circular motion
meanings.sent1: The leaves were rinning in the whirlpool of the stream.
meanings.sent2: The children were rinning around the maypole during the festival.
meanings.sent3: The colorful pinwheel was rinning in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The planets were rinning around the sun in their orbits.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's skirt was rinning gracefully as she twirled on stage.
